The film stars Tom Hulce as General Charles A. Brown, who was the commanding officer of the U.S. Air Force Academy at Fort Leavenworth in Kansas City, Kansas; and also features Oliver Platt as Captain Wally McDougal, who was one of the seven astronauts selected by NASA for its early space program; and also features Jennifer Lawrence as Carol "Major" O'Brien-Davis, who was another of the seven astronauts selected by NASA for its early space program. 

The second movie is "Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind", which is a science fiction novel written by Ursula K. Le Guin in 1984 and also published as "Wee Friends of the World Association" (WFFOTWAAA) in 1986 by the same publisher, and then adapted into several animated television series episodes from 2005 to 2009, and then into a live-action film directed by James Wan released in 2014. 

The first book of "Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind" is "The Windrunner", which is the first part of the novel that was published in the UK as "Ursula Le Guin: The Windrunner (1st edn.)") in 1986 by the same publisher, and then reprinted in 2014 by the same publisher. 

The second book of "Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind" is "A Wizard of Earthsea", which is the third part of the novel that was published in the UK as "Ursula Le Guin: A Wizard of Earthsea (1st edn.)") in 1986 by the same publisher, and then reprinted in 2014 by the same publisher.
